data.headline: S&P 500, Dow, Nasdaq 100, and Russell 2000 futures all slightly higher in quiet premarket trade
bullets: Traders focused on upcoming data releases including retail sales, import/export prices, ADP private payrolls, and NFIB small business optimism
Global equity strength and a tech-led Dow record from yesterday support cautious optimism
AI-linked chip stocks diverge: Credo surges on strong guidance while ON Semiconductor falls on a weak outlook
Earnings in focus from Coca-Cola, S&P Global, CVS, Duke Energy, BP, and Spotify
BP faces continued pressure after suspending its buyback program
Tech sector volatility is prompting some rotation and diversification among traders
Treasury yields hover near four-week lows and the US dollar remains softer
No major early surprises or fresh catalysts in the premarket session
